extendedInfo.description: The U.S. Army Air Defender Application is an unclassified social learning app designed to run primarily on portable phones and other devices running the Android or iOS platforms, but can also be accessed through a standard web browser. The primary goal of the app is to increase Air Defense Artillery (ADA) visibility among top officer candidates helping to encourage them to consider ADA when choosing a placement. Secondary goals include entertaining the player while teaching them about the ADA branch: day to day activities, weapon systems, etc., as well as providing information about the ADA and the army in general to interested civilians.

reviews.title: Challenging
reviews.comment: Challenging game in a good way. Recommended for those who are ECS and ICC crewmembers.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No range rings!
reviews.comment: Have two platforms of weapon systems and NO range rings in which to engage targets.. please fix! I would surely change my rating then. Sincerely, an Air Defender.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great teaching game!
reviews.comment: I learned a lot about the Air Defense Artillery.  Additionally, the mini-game is pretty sweet! Highly recommend this for anyone who\'s thinking of the ADA as a MOS.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Won\'t open!!
reviews.comment: It downloads and powers up fine, but when I try to register, it won\'t let me input info so I can\'t even play
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I like it cuz you can do It all on your owne
reviews.author: Nathan Lesure
